json.text: Nothing hypes up the Bandwagon, more than their hero, gettin that W, with the most epic
of epic 3-point shots. Some are more skilled than others, and sometimes the best things
happen in tens, not JUST threes! SO, Take a look at our list, of greatest 3-point shooters
in the history of the NBA.
Number ten: Vernon Maxwell.
Otherwise known as Mad Max, this gutsy pro made 1256 3-point shots out an an attempted
3931. That’s 32%, which is pretty remarkable, as 3-point shots aren’t exactly the easiest
thing to accomplish – even for the pros!
Number Nine: Tim “Legs” Legler.
Thought 32% was high? Try 43%. Tim is said to be the greatest 3-point shooters the NBA
ever got their hands on, having rose to fame in 95’ for his mind-boggling skills and
jaw-dropping shots.
Number Seven: Dennis Scott.
This incredible 3-point shooter was nicknamed “3D”, thanks to the fact that 3-pointers
were sort of a regular occurrence, on his daily list of accomplishment. In the year
‘95/’96, he made a record with 267 3-pointers – in one season. Those Season Tickets must
a been a work out, cause that's a whole lot of Put your hands up in the air.
Number Six: Ray Allen.
This consistent 3-point shooter, was holding it strong in the league all the way up to
40 years old, and kept it trill as a 40% 3 point shooter.
Number Five: Steve Nash.
Steve is widely regarded as one of the best players to ever play in the league, and is
also a two time MVP, and seven time NBA all-star. His 3-point shot percentage, sits at 43%,
having scored 1474 out of 3421 attempts.
Number Four: Steve Kerr.
This Steve was just as smooth on the court, scoring 726 3-point shots out of 1599 attempts.
Yup, thats over 45%. But he never really got the spotlight he deserved, as he played during
a time, where he shared the court with some of the greatest players in history. Nonetheless,
he deserves a spot on this List.
Number Three: Larry Byrd.
Also known as Larry the Legend, the name says it all, as this highly skilled pro made 649
3-point-shots out of an attempted 1727, and it's not just the shots, but rather because,
he's one of the first small forwards to ever accomplish these numbers.
Number Two: Stephen Curry.
Now this list wouldn't be complete with out this modern day legend, who is still putting
up those numbers. Currently hitting 44% of his 3 pointers, over 1593 3 point shots made
and still counting.
Number One: Reggie Miller.
And we ain't talkin the Kush! Mr. Miller is not ONLY the greatest 3-point shooter of all
time, but he also happens to be one of the greatest NBA players ever. He made an unbelievable
record setting 2,560 3-pointers in his career – which many believe can NEVER be topped
ever. What do YOU think?
Well there you have it, our list of ten greatest 3-point basketball shooters. Have we forgotten
to mention any? If you know of any more Swishologists, please mention them in the comments section,
below. And as always, don’t forget to like, share and subscribe.
